entries.title: Python for Data and Physics
entries.description: Learning Python alongside physics courses for data entry, plotting, and simulations.
entries.content:
Overview

Taking an online Python course while enrolled at UTSA. Applying skills to homework, lab data entry, and small physics simulations. Learning NumPy, Matplotlib, and basic scripting for automation.

entries.title: Physics Lab Observation
entries.description: Observing undergraduate research and lab sessions to gain research exposure.
entries.content:
Overview

Sat in on lab meetings and observations for UTSA physics faculty. Learned lab workflows, experimental setup, and research planning without formal assistantship duties.

entries.title: Study Abroad Planning
entries.description: Planning to study in Athens, Greece for a summer physics program.
entries.content:
Overview

Researching courses and programs in Athens, Greece. Coordinating with UTSA for course credit transfer. Learning logistics for international study and planning schedules around pre-existing travel plans.

entries.title: Protest Poster Design
entries.description: Designed posters with Sharpies for a community protest.
entries.content:
Overview

Planned and executed protest posters with clear text and visual design to convey social messages. Learned visual communication and concise messaging.

entries.title: RYLA Leadership Camp Participation
entries.description: Attended leadership camp and engaged in teamwork and personal development exercises.
entries.content:
Overview

Participated in structured leadership activities and problem-solving exercises. Developed communication, teamwork, and personal leadership skills.

entries.title: Freshman Composition I (WRC 1013)
entries.description: Developed academic writing skills, rhetorical analysis, and argumentation.
entries.content:
Course Overview

Learned essay structure, research integration, and evidence-based writing. Grade: B+

entries.title: Calculus I (MAT 1213)
entries.description: Studied limits, derivatives, and applications of differentiation.
entries.content:
Course Overview

Applied calculus to physics and engineering problems. Grade: A+

entries.title: Calculus II (MAT 1223)
entries.description: Integration techniques, sequences, series, and differential equations.
entries.content:
Course Overview

Building on Calculus I concepts for physics applications. Currently in progress.

entries.title: Physics for Scientists & Engineers I (PHY 1943)
entries.description: Classical mechanics including kinematics, Newtonâ€™s laws, work and energy, momentum, and rotational motion.
entries.content:
Course Overview

Lecture + Lab component (PHY 1951). Applying concepts in lab experiments. In progress.
